feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Fiori
feed.subtitle: SAP Fiori Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Check the Purchasing document status managed by Flexible Workflow as a creator
entry.content:
How to check the Purchasing document status managed by Flexible Workflow as a creator (including PRs, POs, and Contracts) 

  • Are there other ways, besides email notifications, for the creator of a purchasing document to be informed about its approval status?
  • Are there any Fiori apps designed for this purpose?
  • Could the document creator check the status by My Inbox/My Outbox Fiori apps directly, similar to the classic transaction code: SBWP - outbox, like the screenshot below?

entry.title: Data is not getting selected from value help dialog box in the smart table filtering
entry.content:
Hi Team,

i have trying to filtering the table column data.

when i am hitting on value help icon,then some records are visible in the value help dialog box but when i tried to select any one then it is coming blank in the input field.

i am not able to replicate that.please help me out.

 

i am trying to filtering the Reason code data

open value help dialog and selected any value but its not getting in input field.

but i am trying to suggest the value in here its getting records and its selected the value i can able to suggest the value without opening value help dialog.

 

Thanks and regards.

harika kaalla.

Display Custom Attributes in My Inbox | SAP Help Portal

How we can extend that table ... ?

Thanks

entry.title: Partner function not visible in Manage Purchase contract app
entry.content:
Hello,

In the Manage Purchase Contract app when the supplier and other header details are entered the Partner function is not loaded. I am not sure what is wrong, I have checked all the SAP relevant notes but the section is blank. We had a minor upgrade but nothing related to the supplier logic was touched. 

I also ran the F12 browser debug and found no error there. There was no authorisation error in SU53 or dumps in ST22. All the services are running as expected

entry.title: Adaptation project in Fiori HANA: override (onInit, onCustom, etc ) not being called/ not working
entry.content:
I have extended a Fiori HANA App in BAS with an adaptation project and I want to override the methods. 

sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        //,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        //,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.mytimeeventsextension.CustomListReportController", {        
            override: {                
                onExit: function(){
                    debugger;
                },
                test:function(){
                    
                }
            },
            
        });
    }
);

 

{
  "changeType": "codeExt",
  "reference": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/customer.mytimeeventsextension/changes/",
  "creation": "2025-10-31T10:45:14.615Z",
  "projectId": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "moduleName": "customer/mytimeeventsextension/changes/coding/CustomListReportController",
  "support": {
    "generator": "@sap-ux/control-property-editor",
    "sapui5Version": "1.139.0"
  },
  "originalLanguage": "EN",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "change",
  "fileName": "id_1761907511309_262_codeExt",
  "content": {
    "codeRef": "coding/CustomListReportController.js"
  },
  "texts": {},
  "selector": {
    "controllerName": "module:sap/fe/templates/ListReport/ListReportController.controller"
  }
}

 

{
  "fileName": "manifest",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "appdescr_variant",
  "reference": "hcm.fio.mytimeevents1",
  "id": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/hcm.fio.mytimeevents1/appVariants/customer.mytimeeventsextension/",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "content": [
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n",
        "bundleUrl": "i18n/i18n.properties",
        "supportedLocales": [
          "en","de"
        ],
        "fallbackLocale": ""
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "@i18n",

        "supportedLocales": [
          "en","de"
        ],
        "fallbackLocale": ""
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_setMinUI5Version",
      "content": {
        "minUI5Version": "1.120.23"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_app_setTitle",
      "content": {},
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties"
      }
    }
  ]
}

In BAS the methods are being called/processed:

 

this error ist OK (the method test doesn't exist but it shows that tries to process it when the app loads)

 Here is the code from SAP deployed. The debugger doesn't stop and the error from above doesn't show up either

entry.title: sap fiori List Report with Filterbar multi input custom filter
entry.content:
Is there any way to implement preload with variant management on Filterbar (oData v4) custom filter fields Multi Input filter? im currently facing this issue, we have a page with custom filter fields, but im not able to retrieve the value, just using Value implementation mentioned here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/468a97775123488ab3345a0c48cadd8f/5fb9f57fcf12401bbe39a635e9a32a4e.html

we have samples for: Range (primitive), Value (primitive), Multi Input (token) * we do not have native preload

i need a example for sap.fe.macros.filter.type.MultiValue to use with sap.m.MultiInput with value help (to load variant value by native)

i tried to implement preload but fiori keeps preventing this by keeping dirty states, so im opening this topic to see is there any cleaner way to do that

entry.title: beforeOpenContextMenu is not firing when right-clicking on a group header in sap.ui.table.Analytical
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using an SAPUI5 Analytical Table where grouping is implemented at one level.
When I right-click on a group header, the context menu opens with options such as Ungroup Level and Ungroup All.
Since I am using only one grouping level, I would like to hide one of these options (for example, Ungroup Level).
To achieve this, I tried using the beforeOpenContextMenu event to modify the menu items dynamically. However, this event does not trigger when right-clicking on the group header.
On the other hand, the attachColumnSelect event is triggered correctly when right-clicking on a column header (for sorting and filtering), and I am able to hide unwanted menu items there.
I expect similar behavior when right-clicking on the group header to customize that context menu as well.

Steps to Reproduce:
Use an Analytical Table (sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable) with one-level grouping enabled.
Right-click on a column header → attachColumnSelect triggers correctly.
Right-click on a group header (e.g., “Company Code = XXXX”) → context menu appears with Ungroup Level and Ungroup All options.
Observe that the beforeOpenContextMenu event does not trigger.

Expected Behavior:
When the user right-clicks on a group header, the beforeOpenContextMenu event should trigger so that developers can modify or hide specific menu options (for example, remove Ungroup Level when only one grouping level is used).

Actual Behavior:
The context menu is displayed when right-clicking on a group header, but the beforeOpenContextMenu event is not fired.

Code Snippet Used:
const oTable = this.byId("dynamicTable");
// Works on column header right-click
oTable.attachColumnSelect((oEvent) => {
    console.log(oEvent);
});

// Not triggered on group header right-click
oTable.attachBeforeOpenContextMenu((oEvent) => {
    console.log("Context menu event triggered:", oEvent);
});

Please let me know if I am missing anything or if there is an alternative way to capture the context menu event on group headers to modify or remove menu options dynamically.

Regards,
Sridevi

entry.title: CAP backend service through BTP configured Destination
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are writing to request assistance with a configuration issue on our SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment. We are encountering a consistent 500 Internal Server Error when our SAPUI5 application attempts to call a CAP backend service through a configured Destination.

System Architecture:

  • Frontend: A SAPUI5 application (UI5 version 1.140.0) deployed on SAP BTP.

  • Backend: An SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) application deployed as a back-end service on the same BTP CF space.

  • Connectivity: The frontend connects to the backend via a BTP Destination named EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV.

  • Authentication: The connection is secured using OAuth2ClientCredentials flow with an XSUAA service instance as shown below:

 

 

Problem Description:
When the frontend application makes a call to the OData service endpoint (/odata/v4/catalg/), the request fails with a 500 Internal Server Error.

 



 

Troubleshooting Steps and Findings:
We have performed several tests to isolate the issue, and here is what we have confirmed:

  1. The CAP Backend Service is Working: If we call the CAP service endpoint directly using Postman and provide a manually obtained Bearer Token, we receive a 200 OK response with the expected data. This confirms that the service logic is correct.

  2. The BTP Destination is Working: We have successfully tested the EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV destination using the BTP Cockpit's "Check Connection" feature and also by calling the Destination Service API via Postman. In both cases, the destination successfully fetches a valid JWT Bearer Token from the XSUAA service. Here below the evidences:

     




  1. Authentication Flow Seems Partially Correct: We are not receiving 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden errors.

Based on these findings, we believe the issue lies in the interaction between the Approuter, the Destination Service, and the CAP service's security validation.

Configuration Details:

  • Destination: EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV

    • Type: HTTP

    • URL: https://d03-e-invoice01-cf01-d03-e-invoice01-cf01-sp01-fatturaz2a9200d4.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/

    • Proxy Type: Internet

    • Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

    • Client ID: sb-FatturazioneElettronicaAttiva!t566124

    • Token Service URL: https://d03-e-invoice01.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

  • xs-app.json Route Configuration:

codeJSON

{

"source": "^/odata/v4/catalg/(.*)$",

"target": "/odata/v4/catalg/$1",

"destination": "EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV",

"authenticationType": "xsuaa",

"csrfProtection": false

}

 



  • manifest.json DataSource Configuration:

codeJSON

"dataSources": {

"capSrv": {

"uri": "/odata/v4/catalg/",

"type": "OData",

"settings": {

"odataVersion": "4.0"

}

}

}

 



Could someone please assist us in identifying the cause of this 500 error? Any guidance on how to further debug this or what might be misconfigured would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time

entry.title: Missing Graphical Progress of Operations in "Manage Production Orders" Fiori App After S/4HANA Upgra
entry.content:
Hello Community,
After our recent upgrade to S/4HANA 2023, we’ve noticed that the graphical information on  progress of operation bar is missing in the "Manage Production Orders" Fiori app. Previously, we could easily see the information on progress of  operation visually, but now this feature seems to be unavailable or not displaying as expected.

Before

After

What are the best practices to verify and restore such features?

Any guidance, documentation, or experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance.

Nitin

entry.title: ReferenceError: sap is not defined
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

our pipeline is failing with below error in the karma step 

as we are using piper template to run our pipeline we are using KarmaExecutetests step

when we are the tests in local it is running fine but when we run in the pipeline it failing with below error

Chrome Headless 139.0.0.0 (Linux 0.0.0) ERROR
info karmaExecuteTests - Uncaught ReferenceError: sap is not defined
info karmaExecuteTests - at webapp/test/unit/unitTests.qunit.js:1:1
info karmaExecuteTests -
info karmaExecuteTests - ReferenceError: sap is not defined
info karmaExecuteTests - at webapp/test/unit/unitTests.qunit.js:1:1

please find the logs for better understanding attached
below is unittest.qunit.html file

entry.title: How to access and test an extended Fiori app created with Adaptation Project in BAS?
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

I’m seeking your guidance to understand what steps I need to follow to properly access an extended Fiori app. Let me explain the context:

This week, we extended the standard app “Manage Central Purchase Contracts” using an Adaptation Project in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

I had previously done similar extensions using SAP Web IDE, so I assumed the process would be similar. However, I found some differences and a few doubts that I hope you can help me clarify.

After deploying the app to our system, I noticed that the transport request included the following objects, which I hadn’t seen before:

  • App Variant (LRep cross-client content)

  • LRepository cross-client content

My main question is that I don’t know where the new app is located or how to verify that the changes were applied correctly.
Do I need any specific role or authorization to access it?

I’d also like to confirm whether it’s necessary to configure a Fiori Launchpad tile or perform any additional setup to make the extended app available.
If so, where should I look or what objects should I check?

Lastly, due to client security policies, I must request and justify access to specific transactions. I already have the basic Fiori ones, but I’d like to know if there are any additional transactions I should request to complete the setup.

Apologies for the number of questions, but this is my first time extending a standard Fiori app from BAS (we usually work with Custom or Fiori Elements apps).

Thank you very much in advance for your help and guidance!

Edson Bravo.

entry.title: Sap Fiori My Inbox Task Priorty
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I have an app called My Inbox in Fiori. There's a task ranking there. I was asked to hide the area labeled "medium." I found a badi and by debugging it, I discovered that the "medium" text appears in the code block below. But I can't edit it. How can I fix this problem?

This Badi:

/IWPGW/BADI_TGW_TASK_DATA-MODIFY_TASK_TITLE

The data sent to this badi comes from the following method.

The text field I want to remove is displayed on the line below this method. However, when I click inside it, nothing appears; only a single line of data appears.

How can I intervene here? I've been struggling with this issue for a week and haven't found a solution. Please help me. If I'm looking in the wrong places, let me know.

entry.title: How to Create Data via BOI from Custom SAPUI5 App in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m working on an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud scenario where I need to create new data (entity instances) from a custom SAPUI5 application.
The app is already deployed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad and is consuming an OData service that I exposed through ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse. This OData service is based on a custom CDS view.

Now, I want to perform create operations — for example, creating a Production Order Confirmation.
I found the following Business Object Interface (BOI) on the SAP API Business Hub:
👉 I_PRODUCTIONORDCONFIRMATIONTP

However, I’m not sure about the best practice for implementing this BOI interface in the Public Cloud environment:

  • Should I create a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) behavior definition that consumes the BOI interface?

  • Or is there another recommended integration pattern for invoking BOIs from a custom application?

  • How can I trigger the BOI create operation from my custom UI5 app (which currently consumes only my custom CDS service)?

I’d appreciate any guidance, examples, or references on how to correctly implement a BOI-based data creation scenario in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Thank you in advance!
Tadeas

entry.title: How to get a list of standard Fiori applications that are extended in the system?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement to identify if any standard SAP Fiori applications in our system have been extended or enhanced.

Is there any  way to get a list of standard Fiori apps that have been extended in S/4HANA?

We are looking for a reliable method to check which standard apps have been customized, either on the frontend or backend side.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Silent Login of Fiori/UI5 Application
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am currently working with the Fiori/UI5 application that is registered as the mashup in FSM. FSM and Workzone use the same CIS and SSO is enabled. That leads to the fact that when I open a browser, login to FSM and get to my mashup, the application is loaded perfectly.

On the other hand if I close the browser and re-open it, then navigate to FSM - I am automatically logged in since cookie/token is saved. But I can not get my application loaded - the login cookie is not passed to the Workzone and application gets halted. I have to logout manually from FSM and login back to activate the login token and make the application work again.

Is there any mechanism or approach that will help the cookie be passed after I re-open browser and FSM without logging out?

Any help or advise would be really appreciated!

Br,
Aleks.
